column13: Mirvac designed and delivered the Hatch22 program, which upskilled employees on how to apply its award-winning innovation methodology to its projects. The program was designed to cater to all employees Ã¢ÂÂ whether they were new to innovation at Mirvac or wanted to refresh their innovation knowledge and skills. Mirvac also created innovation culture training modules to support leaders in developing the right mindset to operate in a challenging environment.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Mirvac refreshed its Diversity and Inclusion strategy, which builds on its work around gender diversity and flexibility, and expanded its focus on LGBTQ+ and women in construction. Mirvac also continued its focus on mental health, sharpening its focus on major hazards and psychological health and safety.
column20: Diversity and Inclusion Policy, gender diversity, flexibility

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Mirvac celebrated equality and inclusiveness by supporting Sydney WorldPride and the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras in FY23. Mirvac also hosted events for its people in each state head office, including launching its first official LGBTQ+ working group, the Mirvac Pride Committee, consisting of LGBTQ+ colleagues and allies. The Committee is sponsored by Mirvac's Chief Digital Officer and is focused on understanding LGBTQ+ issues and developing initiatives that promote awareness.

column13: Mirvac has continued to collaborate with its peers as a member of the PCA Modern Slavery Working Group. It includes evolving the PCA online supplier self-assessment to help the industry identify and mitigate modern slavery risk. Through this self-assessment, suppliers answer questions outlining their understanding of human rights and modern slavery and their actions to assess and address these issues.
